title: (x) Gold Bond monogram - various {gang}
content:
This type is from a Gold Bond (talc) mark. I assuming it's art based on a typeface.   
 ![GB icon](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000733im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20423.jpg)
author: kylehickman

comments.content: How about something like Mark Simonson's [Blakley](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000733/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/blakely/light/testdrive.html?s=GB&p=72) or [Avenida](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000733/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/avenida/plain/testdrive.html?s=GB&p=72)?

Looking at it again, the �G� is feeling very [ITC Anna](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000733/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-anna/), but the �B� is more [Busorama-esque](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000733/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-busorama/). Mix and match, perhaps?

Grant I've run into a free face once that was called something like monogram and the letter characters were drawn to face one another. Not a very attractive face. Now Gold Bond is an old-time product and it could be a custom job (its only two characters) Dan
Kyle, can I ask what you need the typeface for? Are you trying to recreate the logo?
Grant doesn't the B seem to overwelm the G. It seems larger and heaver, Dan

\>_doesn't the B seem to overwhelm the G._   
\>_It seems larger and heavier_   
   
Yes it does, but that's what the original logotype looks like.
